info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 3:29AM PDT until September 01 at 7:30AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... Northeastern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 730 AM MST /730 AM PDT/. * At 329 AM MST /329 AM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain east of Callville Bay on Lake Mead, extending east toward South Cove and northwest Mohave County. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Cove, Meadview, Overton Beach, Echo Bay, Temple Bar Campground, Echo Bay Campground, Grand Canyon Skywalk, Grand Canyon Ranch, Valley Of Fire and Temple Bar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. If on land, campers and hikers should avoid washes and low-lying areas and seek higher ground. If on the water, put on a life jacket, make your way to a sheltered cove or inlet, and write down GPS coordinates in case a rescue is needed.
